turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm calling about a car accident I was in last week. Claim number is 12345ABC.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for calling. I have your claim 12345ABC pulled up. To confirm, this is regarding the accident on October 26th?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, that's the one. I already submitted the police report and photos. What's the status? I need my car fixed ASAP!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I see that the documents were received. Our team is still reviewing them. We will provide you with updates within 3-5 business days. Please note we are experiencing a higher than usual volume of claims at this time.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: 3-5 business days?! Seriously? I'm going to be late for work every day. Is there anything you can do to speed that up? This is incredibly frustrating.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: While I can't guarantee a faster review, I can add a note to your file indicating the urgency. Also, could you perhaps find alternative methods of transportation, like public transit?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Public transit? Really? This accident wasn't my fault! Are you guys going to cover the rental car while mine is being fixed, or am I just supposed to be stranded?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Whether a rental car is covered depends on your policy. Let me check... it appears that you do have rental car coverage as part of your policy, up to $40 per day. We'll need to get an estimate from the repair shop before authorizing it though. Please send that in as soon as you have it. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
